issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: In some situations, it can be desirable to delete the entirety of a directory's contents, but not the directory itself (e.g. when it's a S3 bucket). Perhaps we should add an option for that.
fields.summary: [C++] FileSystem::DeleteDir should make it optional to delete the directory itself

comments.body: Seems useful. Either as an option to the function or a new API (DeleteDirContents) or similar.

AFAIK folders don't really exist in S3. Once objects inside a folder are deleted the folder no longer exists. So deleting the contents and deleting the folder are the same thing.
See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42442259/delete-a-folder-and-its-content-aws-s3-java
Buckets do exist, though. The implementation of {{DeleteDir}} that's in the patch for ARROW-453 is capable of deleting the bucket

Ah yes, sorry, missed the bucket case.
As an occasional S3 user I would be surprised if arrow deleted a bucket and not only it's contents. But I can imagine it would be useful to have that option sometimes.

So another way to "skin this cat" is simply to not delete buckets in any of the generic filesystem APIs, and instead add a "DeleteBucket" function that is S3-specific. Not sure how challenging this would be to incorporate into the testing regimen
I don't think generic code should have to bother about the notion of "bucket", though. I'll have to think about it more.
Can you treat bucket as root of the filesystem?
